japanese:
あれ？
フータロー君、１人なんだ？
translation: Huh? Futaro-kun, are you alone?

japanese: なんだ、一花か。
translation: Oh, it's Ichika.

japanese:
おやぁ？
なんだか残念そう？
translation:
What now?
You seem a bit disappointed.

japanese: 別に、そんなことはない。
translation: No, not really.

japanese:
ふーん。
まあ、そういうことにしておいてあげよう。
translation: Hmm. Well, let's just leave it at that.

japanese:
ここって郷土村だろ。
お前がこういうところに興味を持つのは意外だな。
translation:
This is the Native Okinawan Village, right?
It's surprising to see you taking an interest
in a place like this.

japanese:
そうかな？
せっかく来たんだし、こういう『まさに沖縄！』って
建物も見ておきたいじゃない。
translation:
Really?
Since I came all the way here, I wanted to see buildings
that truly scream Okinawa!

japanese: あれっ、上杉さん！？
translation: Oh, Uesugi-san?!

japanese:
あ……！
よ、四葉も一緒だったんだな。
translation:
Ah!
Y-Yotsuba, you were here too, huh.

japanese: こんなとこで会うなんて、なんか偶然ですね。
translation: What a coincidence to meet here like this.

japanese:
ああ、偶然だな。
俺もたまたまこっちへ来ただけだからな。
translation: Yeah, it is. I just happened to come this way.

japanese: で、ですよねー。
translation: R-right.

japanese: ふーむ……。
translation: Hmmm...

japanese: 四葉。
translation: Yotsuba.

japanese: うん？　なに？
translation: Hm? What?

japanese:
フータロー君と一緒に見て回りたいなら、
遠慮してないで誘ってみなよ。
translation:
If you want to look around with Futaro-kun,
why don't you invite him instead of hesitating?

japanese: ええっ！？
translation: Whaaaat?!

japanese: うん？　どうかしたのか？
translation: Huh? What's the matter?

japanese: いえいえ！　こっちの話なので！
translation:
Nothing!
We're just talking about something else!

japanese:
い、一花！
いまはちょっとタイミングが……。
translation:
I-Ichika!
The timing now's a little off...

japanese:
ねえ、フータロー君。
四葉と一緒に見て回ったら？
translation:
Hey, Futaro-kun.
How about taking a look around with Yotsuba?

japanese:
はわわっ！？
で、でもいまは一花と見て回ってるんだし！
translation:
Uwawaa?!
B-but I'm looking around at things
with you right now, Ichika!

japanese: 私のことは気にしなくてもいいよ。
translation:
Don't worry about me,
you're free to go wherever you want.

japanese: えーと、けど、あの……。
translation: Umm, well, uh...

japanese:
ほ、ほら！
上杉さんにだって見たいものがありますよね！
私に構わず自由にどうぞ！
translation:
L-look!
Even you must want to see something, right?
Please go ahead, don't mind me!

japanese: そうだな、せっかくの自由行動だしな。
translation: Well, it is free time, isn't it.

japanese:
そうだよ？
せっかくの自由行動なんだよ？
translation:
That's right.
It's your special free time, isn't it?

japanese:
ああ。
だから、それはわかってるが。
translation:
Yeah.
I get what you're saying.

japanese: ううーん、手強い。
translation: Hmm, this is tough.

japanese:
あっ、あれを見てください！
屋根の上にシーサーがいますよ！　ほらっ！
translation:
Ah, look at that!
There's a shisa on the roof! See?!

japanese:
あ、ああ、本当だなぁ！
なんであんな所に置いてあるんだぁ？
translation:
Y-yeah, you're right!
Why is it placed up there?

japanese: もう……。
translation: Come on...

japanese:
一花を気にしないのは無理だろ。
ひとりにすることになるんだし。
translation:
It's impossible to just ignore Ichika.
We'd just be leaving her all alone.

japanese:
そ、そうですよね！
そんなの、わがままですよね！
translation:
Th-that's right!
That'd be so selfish of us!

japanese: わがままを言ってのいいのに。
translation: Even still it's ok to be a little selfish sometimes.

japanese: え？　一花？
translation: Huh? Ichika?

japanese:
フータロー君も四葉も、
いい意味でも悪い意味でも真面目だなぁ。
translation:
Both of you, Futaro-kun and Yotsuba,
are serious, in a good way AND bad way.

japanese:
あっ、あれを見てください！
屋根の上にシーサーがいますよ！　ほらっ！
translation:
Ah, look at that!
There's a shisa on the roof! See?!

japanese:
あ、ああ、本当だなぁ！
なんであんな所に置いてあるんだぁ？
translation:
Y-yeah, you're right!
Why is it placed up there?

japanese: もう……。
translation: Come on...

japanese: 一緒に見て回るのもいいかもな。
translation: It might be nice to go see things together.

japanese: へっ？
translation: Huh?
...Ummm.

japanese:
ふふーん、
さてはうっかり本音が漏れちゃったね？
translation:
Heh, it seems like your true feelings
slipped out accidentally, huh?

japanese: それで？　どうするの？
translation: So? What are you gonna do?

japanese:
いや、まあ、そこは四葉にだって
見たいものがあるだろうし、自由行動なんだから
自分が見たい物を優先すべきだろ？
translation:
Well, even Yotsuba must have things she wants to see,
and since it's free time, I think we should prioritize
what each person wants to see, right?

japanese:
で、ですよね！
だって自由行動なんですから。
translation:
Th-that's right!
It IS free time, after all.

japanese: なにを優先するか決めるのも自由だと思うけどなー。
translation:
I think it's okay for you to decide
what you want to prioritize.

japanese:
あっ、あれを見てください！
屋根の上にシーサーがいますよ！　ほらっ！
translation:
Ah, look at that!
There's a shisa on the roof! See?!

japanese:
あ、ああ、本当だなぁ！
なんであんな所に置いてあるんだぁ？
translation:
Y-yeah, you're right!
Why is it placed up there?

japanese: もう……。
translation: Come on...

japanese: はいはい、シーサーね。
translation: Yeah, yeah, it's a shisa.

japanese:
あれは、その家にいるヒヌカンっていう
かまどの火の神様を守ってるんだって。
translation:
They say it's protecting the 'Hinukan,'
which is the god of the hearth in that house.

japanese:
ほう、そうなのか。
詳しいな。
translation:
Oh, really.
You're quite knowledgeable.

japanese:
実はさっき聞いたばかりなんだ。
解説員さんの受け売りだよ。
translation:
Actually, I just heard it earlier.
It's what the guide told me.

japanese:
あれ？
でも、かまどの神様を守るのに
屋根の上に置くってなんか変じゃない？
translation:
Huh? But, isn't it strange to put it on the roof
to protect the god of the hearth?

japanese:
昔の家はほとんどが茅葺きだったんだって。
だから火事にならないようにってことらしいよ。
translation:
Most old houses used to have thatched roofs,
so it's to prevent fires from breaking out.

japanese: へー、そうなんだ。
translation: Wow, I see.

japanese: なるほどな。
translation: Makes sense.

japanese:
そういえば、街でもシーサーはよく見かけますけど、
口を開けてる子と閉じてる子がいますよね。
translation:
Speaking of which, we often see shisa in the city
with their mouths open or closed, right?

japanese: 多分、阿吽じゃないか？
translation: Probably the A-un pair, yeah?

japanese:
あうん……。
それって神社の狛犬の？
translation:
A-un...
Are those the komainu at shrines?

japanese:
ああ、それだ。
狛犬の阿吽は一対で、
すべての始まりと終わりを意味してるらしい。
translation:
Oh, that's right.
The A-un pair of komainu
symbolizes the beginning and the end of all things.

japanese: その辺は、解説員から説明がなかったのか？
translation: Wasn't that explained by the guide?

japanese:
いやぁ、話を聞いたって言うか、
さっきのも他の人への説明が耳に入っただけなんだよ。
translation:
Well, I didn't hear it directly from the guide.
I just overheard it
when they were explaining to someone else.

japanese: となると、ここはスマホの出番です！
translation:
In that case, it's time to ask for help
from the amazing smartphone!

japanese: えーっと……。
translation: Let me see...

japanese:
シーサーにはオスとメスがあって、
口が開いているのがオスで、閉じているのがメス。
translation:
Shisa come in male and female pairs,
with one with an open mouth being male,
and the one with a closed mouth being female.

japanese:
あれって雄雌だったのか。
知らなかった。
translation: Oh, I didn't know that they were male and female.

japanese:
オスは外敵から家を守って、
メスは幸運を外に逃さないようにしている、
だそうです。
translation:
The male protects the house from external threats,
while the female prevents good fortune
from escaping outside, or so they say.

japanese:
へえー。
それで門の前に置かれてることが多いんだ。
translation:
I see.
That's why they're often placed in front of gates.

japanese: 家を守るために、いつも仲良く一緒にいるんだね。
translation:
They always stick together to protect the house,
don't they?

japanese:
となると、四葉とフータロー君も
仲良く２人がいいかな？
translation:
In that case,
why don't you two go be lovey-dovey too?

japanese: えっ！？
translation: HUH?!

japanese:
私のことは気にせず、
あとはお若い２人で仲良くやってくださいな。
translation:
Don't mind me, just go have fun together,
you two lovebirds.

japanese: だから、お前は変に気を遣うなよ。
translation: I said, stop worrying about us like that.

japanese:
そうですよねっ！
みんなで来てる旅行なんだし、
やっぱり、みんなで楽しまないと！
translation:
That's right! Since we're on a trip together,
we should all have fun together!

japanese:
ほら一花！
次のところを見に行こう！
translation: Come on, Ichika! Let's go see the next place!

japanese:
あーあ、もう。
じゃあフータロー君、また後でね。
translation:
Aa-ah, really, now.
Well then, see you later, Futaro-kun.
